Message: The VRChat SDK has not been found
Response: This error occurs when the VRChat SDK is not correctly imported into the Unity project. To fix this, ensure that the SDK is correctly imported and that the necessary assets are included in the project. You can also try to reload your SDK.

Message: Where can I find good prefabs for VRChat
Response: To find prefabs for worlds and avatars, etc. You can visit the VRCPrefabs Database at vrcprefabs.com

Message: How can I play videos in VRChat
Response: In order to play videos in a VRC World, you will need a video player asset, I recommend ProTV by ArchiTechAnon. If you need to convert a youtube playlist to ProTV format, you can use ifBars/ProTVConverter on github

Message: How can I create a custom emotes in VRChat?
Response: You can create custom emotes in VRChat by using Unity and the VRChat SDK. First, you will need to create an animation in Unity and then use the VRC_Emote component to add the animation to a prefab. Once the prefab is uploaded to VRChat, players can use the emote by selecting it in the emote menu.

Message: How can I create a custom world in VRChat?
Response: You can create a custom world in VRChat by using Unity and the VRChat SDK. First, you will need to create the assets and layout for your world in Unity and then use the VRC_SceneDescriptor component to add the scene to a prefab. Once the prefab is uploaded to VRChat, players can enter your world by clicking on it in the world list.

Message: How can I create a custom avatar in VRChat?
Response: You can create a custom avatar in VRChat by using Unity and the VRChat SDK. First, you will need to create the assets for your avatar in Unity and then use the VRC_AvatarDescriptor component to add the avatar to a prefab. Once the prefab is uploaded to VRChat, players can use your avatar by selecting it in the avatar menu.

Message: How can I create a custom teleport system in VRChat?
Response: You can create a custom teleport system in VRChat by using Unity and the VRChat SDK. I suggest PlayerBush001's 'How to Teleport a Player - Udon / VRChat SDK3.0' youtube video.

Message: VRChat SDK Error: VRC_EventHandler has not been added to the scene.
Response: This error occurs when the VRC_EventHandler is not added to the scene. To fix this, you need to add the VRC_EventHandler prefab to the scene from the VRChat SDK folder.

Message: VRChat SDK Error: VRC_SceneDescriptor has not been added to the scene.
Response: This error occurs when the VRC_SceneDescriptor is not added to the scene. To fix this, you need to add the VRC_SceneDescriptor prefab to the scene from the VRChat SDK folder.

Message: '' does not contain a definition for ''.
Response: This error occurs when the compiler cannot find a definition for a specific member (such as a field or method) in the specified class or namespace. Check if you are using the correct version of unity.

Message: VRChat SDK Error: VRC_AvatarDescriptor is not found on the player.
Response: This error occurs when the VRC_AvatarDescriptor is not found on the player object. To fix this, you need to add the VRC_AvatarDescriptor component to the player object from the VRChat SDK folder.

Message: VRChat SDK Error: VRC_Player has not been added to the scene.
Response: This error occurs when the VRC_Player is not added to the scene. To fix this, you need to add the VRC_Player prefab to the scene from the VRChat SDK folder.

Message: Failed to Upload World
Response: This error can occur when there is a problem with the Unity project, such as missing assets or incorrect settings. Make sure that all assets are properly imported and that the build settings are correct.

Message: The SDK Control Panel is blank and does not show any options / missing VRCUrlInputField
Response: In the Project window, navigate to Assets/VRCSDK/Plugins, Select all DLLs, right-click and then press 'Reimport' This should also fix the issue if your Video Players no longer have a VRCUrlInputField.

Message: Could not find a valid world prefab
Response: This error can occur if the world prefab is missing or is not properly set up. Make sure that the world prefab is correctly set up and that all necessary assets are included in the project.

Message: Could not find a valid player prefab
Response: This error can occur if the player prefab is missing or is not properly set up. Make sure that the player prefab is correctly set up and that all necessary assets are included in the project.

Message: Failed to create an instance of the world
Response: This error can occur if there is a problem with the world prefab or the build settings. Make sure that the world prefab is correctly set up and that the build settings are correct.

Message: Failed to create an instance of the player
Response: This error can occur if there is a problem with the player prefab or the build settings. Make sure that the player prefab is correctly set up and that the build settings are correct.

Message: Invalid scene format
Response: This error can occur when the scene format is not compatible with VRChat. Ensure that the scene is properly set up and that all assets are correctly added.

Message: is not exposed to udon
Response: This error can occur when a Udon script in your scene is using a method that is not exposed to Udon. This is something you would have to fix in the code of the script.

Message: how to use crunch compression
Response: If your VRC world is big in file size, you can use crunch texture compression, and mesh compression to shrink your world. I suggest Iconoclass's 'Reduce Build Size of Large Unity Scenes' video on youtube.

Message: Crunch Compression can only be used with POT Textures
Response: In order to use Crunch Compression with textures, your textures must be POT textures, this means Power of Two, I suggest you google POT Textures for more info.

Message: World Size too big
Response: If your VRC world is big in file size, you can use crunch texture compression, and mesh compression to shrink your world. I suggest Iconoclass's 'Reduce Build Size of Large Unity Scenes' video on youtube.

Message: How can I shrink the size of my world
Response: If your VRC world is big in file size, you can use crunch texture compression, and mesh compression to shrink your world. I suggest Iconoclass's 'Reduce Build Size of Large Unity Scenes' video on youtube.

Message: My world is too big
Response: If your VRC world is big in file size, you can use crunch texture compression, and mesh compression to shrink your world. I suggest Iconoclass's 'Reduce Build Size of Large Unity Scenes' video on youtube.

Message: that references a missing script. Please change the script or remove it from the GameObject.
Response: Check the name of the GameObject in the error that is sorrounded by ''. This object most likely is missing a reference to a script it once had. Either drag the script back on or delete the empty reference.

Message: does not exist in the namespace 'UnityEngine' (are you missing an assembly reference?)
Response: Check the version of unity you are using. Confirm you are using Unity version 2019.4.31f1

Message: could not be loaded when loading game object
Response: Check the version of unity you are using. Confirm you are using Unity version 2019.4.31f1

Message: Please change the script or remove it from the GameObject.
Response: Check the name of the GameObject in the error that is sorrounded by ''. This object most likely is missing a reference to a script it once had. Either drag the script back on or delete the empty reference.

Message: The name '' does not exist in the current context
Response: This error occurs when the variable or class you are trying to use has not been declared or is not in scope. Make sure that the variable or class has been properly declared and that it is in the correct scope.

Message: Type '' already defines a member called '' with the same parameter types.
Response: This occurs when a method or property is defined with the same name and parameters as another method or property in the same class or struct.

Message: '' is inaccessible due to its protection level.
Response: This occurs when trying to access a member that has a more restrictive access level (e.g. private) than the current context.

Message: The type or namespace name '' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)
Response: This occurs when a type or namespace is not found in the current project.

Message: The type name '' does not exist in the type ''.
Response: This occurs when a type is not found in the specified namespace or assembly.

Message: No overload for method '' takes '' arguments.
Response: This occurs when calling a method with the wrong number of arguments.

Message: Use of unassigned local variable ''.
Response: This occurs when a local variable is used without being assigned a value first.

Message: '' does not contain a definition for '' and no accessible extension method '' accepting a first argument of type '' could be found.
Response: This occurs when trying to access a member that does not exist on an object.

Message: Inconsistent accessibility: parameter type '' is less accessible than method ''.
Response: This occurs when the accessibility of a parameter is more restrictive than the accessibility of the containing method.

Message: A local or parameter named '' cannot be declared in this scope because that name is used in an enclosing scope to define a local or parameter.
Response: This occurs when a local variable or parameter is declared with the same name as another local variable or parameter in an enclosing scope.

Message: '' in explicit interface declaration is not a member of interface.
Response: This occurs when an explicit interface implementation references a member that does not exist in the interface.

Message: Cannot implicitly convert type '' to ''
Response: This error occurs when you are trying to assign a variable of one type to a variable of another type without an explicit conversion. You need to use a cast or a conversion method to convert the value to the correct type.

Message: An object reference is required for the non-static field, method, or property ''
Response: This error occurs when you are trying to access a non-static member of a class without creating an instance of the class. To fix this, you need to create an instance of the class before accessing the non-static member.
